meanings.definition: Express (an idea or feeling) in too many words.
meanings.sent1: She always overarticulates her thoughts, making it hard to follow her.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overarticulate his emotions, causing misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: When he overarticulates his excitement, it sounds like a never-ending story.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overarticulate turned her speech into a tangled web of words.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's overarticulation of the instructions made the students confused.

meanings.definition: Speak or pronounce (something) clearly and distinctly.
meanings.sent1: He overarticulates each syllable to ensure everyone understands him.
meanings.sent2: She overarticulates her words when speaking to a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The robot overarticulated its commands, sounding like a strict teacher.
meanings.sent4: His voice overarticulated the silence in the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The singer overarticulated every note, captivating the audience with her clarity.
